pullrequest.title: add Young's modulus and Poisson's ratio for all the haptix objects

content.raw: I just pulled the ARAT stone out of the box, and it appears to be an "Arkansas stone" used for knife sharpening. Some googling showed that it is Novaculite (ie. chert or flint). One discussion [suggests using quartz material properties](http://www.researchgate.net/post/Could_anyone_suggest_any_work_concerning_mechanical_properties_of_chert_in_particular_Youngs_modulus) (between 72-97 GPa), while a [journal paper about heat treating chert](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/BF00547934) lists 72-88 GPa. These are the same order of magnitude as Portland cement.
content.html: I just pulled the ARAT stone out of the box, and it appears to be an "Arkansas stone" used for knife sharpening. Some googling showed that it is Novaculite (ie. chert or flint). One discussion suggests using quartz material properties (between 72-97 GPa), while a journal paper about heat treating chert lists 72-88 GPa. These are the same order of magnitude as Portland cement.
